se.lu.nateko.edca.svc

Class LocalSQLDBhelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • se.lu.nateko.edca.svc.LocalSQLDBhelper

  • public class LocalSQLDBhelper
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
    COPYRIGHT*********************************** This file is part of the Emergency Data Collector for Android™ (EDCA). * Copyright © 2013 Mattias Spångmyr. * * LICENSE************************************ EDCA is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under * the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free * Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your * option) any later version. * * EDCA is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY * WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or * FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License * for more details. * * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along * with EDCA. If not, see "http://www.gnu.org/licenses/". * * The latest source for this software can be accessed at * "github.org/mattiassp/edca". * * EDCA also utilizes the JTS Topology Suite, Version 1.8 by Vivid * Solutions Inc. It is released under the Lesser General Public License * ("http://www.gnu.org/licenses/") and its source can be accessed at the * JTS Topology Suite website ("http://www.vividsolutions.com/jts"). * * Android™ is a trademark of Google Inc. The Android source is released * under the Apache License 2.0 * ("http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0") and can be accessed at * "http://source.android.com/". * * For other enquiries, e-mail to: edca.contact@gmail.com * * SQLiteOpenHelper subclass for storing database handling strings and for * making SQL queries to the local database. * * For the table in the database storing layers, the column "mode" stores * how the layer is used, where the mode is the product of the multiples * associated with all enabled states. The (prime) multiples of their * available states are: * 1 = Inactive (not used). * 2 = Display (in a GetMap request). * 3 = Stored on the external storage. * 5 = Active (targeted for data collection). *
    Version:
    0.44, 2013-07-24 * *
    Author:
    Mattias Spångmyr *

      • RECENT_RECORD

        public static final int RECENT_RECORD
        Constant identifying a "fetch most recent ServerConnection" mode for reading from the database (using a SELECT statement). What it really does is it returns the first record when the result table is sorted by the second column.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public LocalSQLDBhelper open()
                      throws SQLException
        Open the local SQLite database. If it cannot be opened, try to create a new instance of the database. If it cannot be created, throw an exception to signal the failure.
        Returns:
        this Self reference, allowing this to be chained in an initialization call.
        Throws:
        SQLException - Thrown if the database could be neither opened nor created.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(SQLiteDatabase db)

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase db,
             int oldVersion,
             int newVersion)

      • fetchData

        public Cursor fetchData(java.lang.String table,
               java.lang.String[] columns,
               long record,
               java.lang.String extraCondition,
               boolean noOrder)
                 throws SQLException
        Fetches records from the local SQL database. A 0 as argument returns all records, -1 returns the most recently used server connection and other positive integers return the record with the corresponding ID.
        Parameters:
        table - A String with the table name in the local SQLite database.
        columns - A String array with the columns to retrieve. Should include the ID as the first column.
        record - An Integer argument specifying which record(s) to return.
        extraCondition - If an additional condition is required, send it here.
        noOrder - Pass true to avoid ordering the records, i.e. to keep the table order, else false.
        Returns:
        Cursor pointing to the row(s) in the table to be retrieved, or null if nothing was found.
        Throws:
        SQLException - If no record(s) could be found/retrieved.

      • insertData

        public long insertData(java.lang.String table,
              java.lang.String[] column,
              java.lang.String[] value)
        Insert a new row into the specified table using the column names and values provided. If the note is successfully created return the new rowId for that note, otherwise return a -1 to indicate failure.
        Parameters:
        table - The name of the table to add data to.
        column - Array of column names specifying which columns to add data to.
        value - The value to insert in the corresponding columns given by 'column'.
        Returns:
        The row id or -1 if the insert failed.

      • updateData

        public boolean updateData(java.lang.String table,
                 long rowId,
                 java.lang.String key_id,
                 java.lang.String[] columns,
                 java.lang.String[] values)
        Update data in the local SQLite database using the details provided. The row to be updated is specified using the rowId, and it is altered to use the String values passed in.
        Parameters:
        table - The name of the table to update.
        rowId - ID of the row to update.
        key_id - The name of the ID column in the table.
        columns - String array with the names of the columns to change.
        values - String array with the values to set for the columns.
        Returns:
        true If the note was successfully updated, otherwise false.

      • deleteData

        public boolean deleteData(java.lang.String table,
                 java.lang.String idField,
                 long rowId,
                 java.lang.String extraCondition)
        Delete a specified (or all) rows in a given table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to delete from.
        idField - The name of the ID field.
        rowId - The ID of the row to delete. 0 means delete all.
        extraCondition - An extra condition specifying which rows to delete.
        Returns:
        True if deleted successfully, otherwise false.

      • createFieldTable

        public void createFieldTable(java.lang.String layerName)
        Create a table to hold the field information of a layer.
        Parameters:
        layerName - The name of the layer whose fields are specified in the resulting table.

      • getSQLiteDB

        public SQLiteDatabase getSQLiteDB()
        Fetches the local SQLiteDatabase in order to perform e.g. exec commands.
        Returns:
        The database managed by this helper.
